intro: Centaurea hedgei, commonly known as the hedge thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, spiny foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring dark green, serrated leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually purple to pink in color, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Centaurea hedgei is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in sunny, well-drained environments.
